citation.article-title: Agitococcus lubricus gen. nov. sp. nov., a lipolytic, twitching coccus from freshwater.

p.s: Description of Agitococcus lubricus sp. nov.
Gram-negative cocci, 1.0 to 2.0 μm in diameter, which distend with sudanophilic inclusions in old cultures.
Glucose is neither oxidized nor fermented.
Tween 80, Tween 40, and Tween 20 are hydrolyzed.
Tributyrin, starch, cellulose, and alginate are not hydrolyzed.
Proteolysis of skim milk is positive.
Hemolysis of horse blood erythrocytes is negative.
Decolorization of chocolate agar is negative.
Tryptophane and phenylalanine are not deaminated.
Growth occurs at 15 and 37°C but not at 4 or 41°C.
Growth occurs at pH 6.0 and 10.0 but not at pH 5.0.
No growth occurs in the presence of 1.0% sodium chloride, but growth occurs with 0.5% sodium chloride.
Susceptible to antibiotics (penicillin G, 4 U; chloramphenichloramphenicol, 25 μg; tetracycline, 10 μg; kanamycin, 30 μg; neomycin, 10 μg; erythromycin, 5 μg; and streptomycin, 10 μg).
The G+C content of the DNA is 42.2 ± 1.0 mol%
The ecological role of A. lubricus appears to be the degradation of lipids in freshwater bodies or in the lipid films on the surfaces of freshwater
